title: Key week in Parliament: how MPs could pass the Brexit deal or trigger an election
text:
It’s another key week in Parliament for Brexit. After Boris Johnson failed to win support for his deal on Saturday and was forced to ask for an extension, the Government will try once more this week to get the deal approved.

Here are the key events this week and why they matter.

Monday – another meaningful vote?

The Government will try and bring the deal back to the Commons for another meaningful vote. However, with Sir Oliver Letwin having successfully identified the potential for the UK to leave without a deal anyway, this vote could be hard for the Government to win.

More importantly, the Speaker, John Bercow, has to decide whether to allow the vote at all. The rules of the Commons dictate...
description: It’s another key week in Parliament for Brexit.
